duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage accounts receivable and delinquency, including rent collection, communication, and legal proceedings.
Track and grow community goals relative to resident satisfaction and retention.
Respond to resident and prospect inquiries with professionalism and excellent customer service.
Maintain operational standards of excellence, including leasing reports, paperwork, and compliance.
Train, coach, and provide positive reinforcement for leasing associates.
Prepare and distribute various resident communications and participate in ongoing resident relationship-building activities.
Review community box score, leasing reports, exposure by unit type, and competitor set daily, and seek and recruit energetic and qualified new associates.
Attend required training and ensure compliance of all training requirements.
Hold team members accountable for their individual roles and participate or lead disciplinary processes for team members who are not performing.
Physically inspect the community, pick up litter, and report any risks or service needs to the maintenance team and Community Manager.
Perform any other tasks as deemed necessary by the supervisor.

education_certification.credential: BS/BA degree or equivalent level of training and work experience preferred. 3 years of relevant experience showing a progression in career development. 2 years of hands-on supervisory experience.
